title: Why is there no button to sync/refresh everything
content:
First things first, I do know about the button on the top left that synchronizes my emails. But it doesn't seem to work for folders.

I noticed the problem when I went to my server, changed the location of a folder (moved it under another one) and then went back to thunderbird. Of course, the folder didn't automatically change but I was ok with that, but to my surprise when I hit the button on the top left, I found out that nothing changed (And clicking on the folder that I moved gave a "this folder doesn't exist on the server" type of message).

After reading this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1113404

I realized that this problem has existed for years, I minimized the email, went to another email (like the thread implies as the best solution, clicked on the local folders as well and then returned to the email that I was working on. And like magic the folder in front of my eyes moved under the other folder. That means that closing and reopening thunderbird would work as well, but I really don't think that should be a solution. Other programs like outlook show you that they are also searching for changes in the folders as well when you hit the sync button. Why is there no similar functionality in thunderbird?
